intro: Malachra rosea, commonly known as the pink starbursts, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to store water in arid environments. Malachra rosea is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
